description: Skill registry for Roscoe paralegal agent. Skills are dynamically loaded based on semantic matching to user requests.

skills.name: medical-records-analysis
skills.description: Use when analyzing medical records for personal injury cases - orchestrates comprehensive 5-phase workflow including fact investigation, organization, extraction, inconsistency detection, causation analysis, and summary writing

skills.name: fact-investigation
skills.description: Use when analyzing litigation documents, accident photos, audio recordings (911 calls), or video evidence (body camera, dashcam) - requires multimodal analysis and code execution capabilities

skills.name: medical-organization
skills.description: Use when creating an inventory or catalog of medical records and bills - simple listing and categorization task

skills.name: record-extraction
skills.description: Use when extracting structured medical data from specific medical records or documents - requires accuracy for medical details and terminology

skills.name: inconsistency-detection
skills.description: Use when identifying contradictions or discrepancies in medical records - requires reasoning to compare statements across documents

skills.name: red-flag-identification
skills.description: Use when identifying case weaknesses, pre-existing conditions, treatment gaps, or problematic statements - requires legal and medical judgment

skills.name: causation-analysis
skills.description: Use when evaluating the causal relationship between an incident and claimed injuries - requires complex medical-legal reasoning

skills.name: missing-records-detection
skills.description: Use when identifying gaps in medical documentation or missing records that should be obtained - requires pattern recognition

skills.name: summary-writing
skills.description: Use when synthesizing comprehensive attorney-ready case summaries from multiple analysis reports - complex synthesis task

skills.name: legal-research
skills.description: Use when researching legal topics, statutes, case law, expert witnesses, medical literature, or general information - delegates to research agent with internet search capabilities

skills.name: case-file-organization
skills.description: Use when organizing disorganized case files, standardizing filenames, categorizing documents into folders, or applying file naming conventions - implements 8-bucket system (Case Information, Client, Investigation, Medical Records, Insurance, Lien, Expenses, Negotiation Settlement, Litigation) with standardized naming for personal injury cases

skills.name: import-case-documents
skills.description: Use when pre-processing/importing all PDFs in a case folder to markdown format for fast agent access - batch converts all PDFs to .md files with quality tracking and creates document index

skills.name: courtlistener-legal-research
skills.description: Use when conducting legal research for motions, briefs, case law precedent, citation network analysis (Shepardizing), or docket monitoring - orchestrates comprehensive legal research workflows using CourtListener API
use_cases: Research precedent for motion or brief writing
Find Kentucky case law on specific legal issues
Explore citation networks (Shepardizing key cases)
Track all cases where attorney is listed
Monitor upcoming court dates and deadlines
Get complete docket sheets with all filings
Build comprehensive legal research around legal doctrine

courts_covered.coverage_notes: Excellent coverage of appellate courts. Limited trial court coverage.

skills.name: multimedia-evidence-trigger
skills.description: Use when user asks to analyze audio or video evidence - triggers delegation to multimodal sub-agent with multimedia-evidence-analysis skill for context-aware analysis
use_cases: Recognize multimedia analysis requests and delegate to multimodal-agent
Main agent trigger for audio/video analysis workflow

skills.name: multimedia-evidence-analysis
skills.description: FOR MULTIMODAL SUB-AGENT ONLY - Complete instructions for analyzing audio or video evidence with case context - loads case overview, accident report, litigation documents, then uses Gemini's native multimodal capabilities to analyze with full context and provide attorney-ready report
use_cases: Analyze 911 calls with case context (identify speakers based on case facts)
Review dashcam footage with understanding of accident narrative
Analyze body camera recordings with knowledge of client's version
Transcribe depositions with context about what to listen for
Review surveillance video with case timeline understanding
Provide attorney-ready analysis with legal observations
workflow: Phase 1: Load case context (case_information/overview.json, Investigation/accident report, Litigation/complaint)
Phase 2: Analyze multimedia with Gemini File API (native audio/video processing)
Phase 3: Extract video frames at key moments (if applicable)
Phase 4: Write attorney-ready report with transcript, speaker ID, visual timeline, legal analysis, citations

skills.name: medical-chronology
skills.description: Use when creating a standalone medical chronology or treatment timeline - synthesizes all medical record extraction reports into comprehensive chronological narrative with timeline gaps, financial summary, and attorney-ready formatting
use_cases: Create standalone medical chronology from extraction reports
Synthesize treatment timeline for settlement demand
Generate chronological summary for attorney review
Build narrative timeline with gap analysis
Combine multiple extraction reports into single chronology
prerequisites: If no extractions exist, run record-extraction first or use medical-records-analysis skill

skills.name: script-execution
skills.description: Use when executing Python scripts from /Tools/ with direct GCS filesystem access - runs scripts in Docker containers for file operations, data processing, web scraping, and automation tasks
use_cases: Run /Tools/ scripts with filesystem access
Execute data processing scripts
Run file organization scripts
Perform batch operations on case folders
Web scraping with Playwright browser
Execute legal research scripts
Run medical research scripts

skills.name: email-management
skills.description: Use when managing case-related email communications - searching inbox, reading emails, sending messages, creating drafts for attorney review, and tracking email threads with clients, adjusters, and opposing counsel
use_cases: Search for case-related emails by sender, subject, or date
Read full email content and attachments list
Send case status updates to clients
Create draft emails for attorney review before sending
Get complete email thread for context
Track correspondence with insurance adjusters
Find demand letter responses
skills.security_notes: Requires Google OAuth credentials (GOOGLE_CREDENTIALS_FILE). First-time use opens browser for authentication.

skills.name: calendar-scheduling
skills.description: Use when managing case deadlines, scheduling depositions, hearings, client meetings, or tracking important dates - view calendar, create events, find available time slots, and manage appointments
use_cases: View upcoming deadlines and appointments
Create statute of limitations deadline events
Schedule depositions with proper duration
Book client meetings at available times
Track court hearing dates
Set discovery response deadlines
Find available time slots for scheduling
Create reminder events for follow-ups
skills.security_notes: Requires Google OAuth credentials (GOOGLE_CREDENTIALS_FILE). Default timezone: America/New_York (set DEFAULT_TIMEZONE to change).
